subject: Marketing
title: Why People Resist Marketing
description: A quick, practical guide to Why People Resist Marketing.

hook.text: The average person sees up to 10,000 ads per day. Most are instantly ignored.

buildup.text: Our brains evolved to filter noise. Modern advertising is the noisiest signal ever.

discovery.text: Resistance isn't laziness. It's a survival mechanism against information overload.

twist.text: The harder you push, the harder people resist. Aggressive ads often backfire.

climax.text: Effective marketing works with the brain's filters, not against them.

quiz.question: Why do people instinctively resist most marketing messages?
options: It's a survival mechanism against information overload
They have been trained to ignore all advertisements
Marketing resistance is a learned cultural behavior
